verses.verse: <S%H7121>Call<s%> now, if there <S%H3426>be<s%> any that will <S%H6030>answer<s%> thee; and to which of the <S%H6918>saints<s%> wilt thou <S%H6437>turn<s%>?
For <S%H3708>wrath<s%> <S%H2026>killeth<s%> the foolish <S%H191>man<s%>, and <S%H7068>envy<s%> <S%H4191>slayeth<s%> the silly <S%H6601>one<s%>.
I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> the <S%H191>foolish<s%> taking <S%H8327>root<s%>: but <S%H6597>suddenly<s%> I <S%H5344>cursed<s%> his <S%H5116>habitation<s%>.
His <S%H1121>children<s%> are <S%H7368>far<s%> from <S%H3468>safety<s%>, and they are <S%H1792>crushed<s%> in the <S%H8179>gate<s%>, neither is there any to <S%H5337>deliver<s%> them.

Whose <S%H7105>harvest<s%> the <S%H7457>hungry<s%> eateth <S%H398>up<s%>, and <S%H3947>taketh<s%> it even <S%H413>out<s%> of the <S%H6791>thorns<s%>, and the <S%H6782>robber<s%> swalloweth <S%H7602>up<s%> their <S%H2428>substance<s%>.
Although <S%H205>affliction<s%> cometh not <S%H3318>forth<s%> of the <S%H6083>dust<s%>, neither doth <S%H5999>trouble<s%> spring <S%H6779>out<s%> of the <S%H127>ground<s%>;
Yet <S%H120>man<s%> is <S%H3205>born<s%> unto <S%H5999>trouble<s%>, as the <S%H1121%H7565>sparks<s%> <S%H5774>fly<s%> <S%H1361>upward<s%>.
I would <S%H199%H1875>seek<s%> unto <S%H410>God<s%>, and unto <S%H430>God<s%> would I <S%H7760>commit<s%> my <S%H1700>cause<s%>:
Which <S%H6213>doeth<s%> great <S%H1419>things<s%> and <S%H369%H2714>unsearchable<s%>; marvellous <S%H6381>things<s%> without <S%H4557>number<s%>:
Who <S%H5414>giveth<s%> <S%H4306>rain<s%> <S%H6440>upon<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%>, and <S%H7971>sendeth<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%> <S%H6440>upon<s%> the <S%H2351>fields<s%>:
To set <S%H7760>up<s%> on <S%H4791>high<s%> those that be <S%H8217>low<s%>; that those which <S%H6937>mourn<s%> may be <S%H7682>exalted<s%> to <S%H3468>safety<s%>.
He <S%H6565>disappointeth<s%> the <S%H4284>devices<s%> of the <S%H6175>crafty<s%>, so that their <S%H3027>hands<s%> cannot <S%H6213>perform<s%> their <S%H8454>enterprise<s%>.
He <S%H3920>taketh<s%> the <S%H2450>wise<s%> in their own <S%H6193>craftiness<s%>: and the <S%H6098>counsel<s%> of the <S%H6617>froward<s%> is carried <S%H4116>headlong<s%>.
They <S%H6298>meet<s%> with <S%H2822>darkness<s%> in the <S%H3119>daytime<s%>, and <S%H4959>grope<s%> in the <S%H6672>noonday<s%> as in the <S%H3915>night<s%>.
But he <S%H3467>saveth<s%> the <S%H34>poor<s%> from the <S%H2719>sword<s%>, from their <S%H6310>mouth<s%>, and from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H2389>mighty<s%>.
So the <S%H1800>poor<s%> hath <S%H8615>hope<s%>, and <S%H5766>iniquity<s%> <S%H7092>stoppeth<s%> her <S%H6310>mouth<s%>.
Behold, <S%H835>happy<s%> is the <S%H582>man<s%> whom <S%H433>God<s%> <S%H3198>correcteth<s%>: therefore <S%H3988>despise<s%> not thou the <S%H4148>chastening<s%> of the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%>:
For he maketh <S%H3510>sore<s%>, and bindeth <S%H2280>up<s%>: he <S%H4272>woundeth<s%>, and his <S%H3027>hands<s%> make <S%H7495>whole<s%>.
He shall <S%H5337>deliver<s%> thee in <S%H8337>six<s%> <S%H6869>troubles<s%>: yea, in <S%H7651>seven<s%> there shall no <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H5060>touch<s%> thee.
In <S%H7458>famine<s%> he shall <S%H6299>redeem<s%> thee from <S%H4194>death<s%>: and in <S%H4421>war<s%> from the <S%H3027>power<s%> of the <S%H2719>sword<s%>.
Thou shalt be <S%H2244>hid<s%> from the <S%H7752>scourge<s%> of the <S%H3956>tongue<s%>: neither shalt thou be <S%H3372>afraid<s%> of <S%H7701>destruction<s%> when it <S%H935>cometh<s%>.
At <S%H7701>destruction<s%> and <S%H3720>famine<s%> thou shalt <S%H7832>laugh<s%>: neither shalt thou be <S%H3372>afraid<s%> of the <S%H2416>beasts<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>.
For thou shalt be in <S%H1285>league<s%> with the <S%H68>stones<s%> of the <S%H7704>field<s%>: and the <S%H2416>beasts<s%> of the <S%H7704>field<s%> shall be at <S%H7999>peace<s%> with thee.
And thou shalt <S%H3045>know<s%> that thy <S%H168>tabernacle<s%> shall be in <S%H7965>peace<s%>; and thou shalt <S%H6485>visit<s%> thy <S%H5116>habitation<s%>, and shalt not <S%H2398>sin<s%>.
Thou shalt <S%H3045>know<s%> also that thy <S%H2233>seed<s%> shall be <S%H7227>great<s%>, and thine <S%H6631>offspring<s%> as the <S%H6212>grass<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>.
Thou shalt <S%H935>come<s%> to thy <S%H6913>grave<s%> in a full <S%H3624>age<s%>, like as a shock of <S%H1430>corn<s%> cometh <S%H5927>in<s%> in his <S%H6256>season<s%>.
Lo this, we have <S%H2713>searched<s%> it, so it is; <S%H8085>hear<s%> it, and <S%H3045>know<s%> thou it for thy good.
